alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Canadian; Comanche; Grady; Jackson; Kiowa; Oklahoma; Tillman (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 7:31AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Comanche, northwestern Grady, Caddo, west central Oklahoma, east central Jackson, southeastern Kiowa, northern Tillman and southern Canadian Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 730 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of El Reno to 7 miles west of Meers to 4 miles west of Humphreys. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Oklahoma City, Lawton, El Reno, Chickasha, Anadarko, Yukon, Bethany, Mustang, Warr Acres, Tuttle, Cache, Elgin, Union City, Minco, Apache, Snyder, Fletcher, Cyril, Sterling, and Binger. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 114 and 144. Interstate 44 between mile markers 37 and 90. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Caddo; Canadian; Comanche; Grady; Jackson; Kiowa; Oklahoma; Tillman
